ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Prerequisites/Preconditions] The endpoint (4) that is returned by either the Autodiscover Publishing Lookup SOAP-Based Web Service Protocol, as described in [MS-OXWSADISC], or the Autodiscover Publishing and Lookup Protocol, as described in [MS-OXDSCLI], is required to form the HTTP request to the Web server that hosts this protocol.

[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] To retrieve the endpoint (4) as described in either the Autodiscover Publishing Lookup SOAP-Based Web Service Protocol or the Autodiscover Publishing and Lookup Protocol, the client needs to have a valid mail-enabled account.
[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] The operations that this protocol defines cannot be accessed unless the correct endpoint (4) is identified in the HTTP Web requests that target this protocol.
[In Messages]In the following sections [section 2], the schema definition might differ from the processing rules imposed by the protocol.
[In Messages]The WSDL in this specification provides a base description of the protocol.
[In Messages]The schema in this specification provides a base description of the message syntax.
[In Messages]The schema in this specification provides a base description of the message syntax.

[In Messages]For example, the schema definition might allow for an element to be empty, null, or not present but the behavior of the protocol as specified restricts the same elements to being non-empty, not null, or present.
[In Transport] Messages are transported by using SOAP version 1.1, as specified in [SOAP1.1].
[In Transport] This protocol relies on the Web server that hosts the application to perform authentication.
[In Transport] The protocol MUST support SOAP over HTTP, as specified in [RFC2616].
[In Transport] [The protocol] SHOULD support SOAP over HTTPS, as specified in [RFC2818].
[In Common Message Syntax] This section contains common definitions that are used by this protocol.
[In Common Message Syntax] The syntax of the definitions uses XML schema, as defined in [XMLSCHEMA1] and [XMLSCHEMA2], and WSDL, as defined in [WSDL].
[In Namespaces] This specification defines and references various XML namespaces using the mechanisms specified in [XMLNS].

[In Namespaces] Although this specification associates a specific XML namespace prefix for each XML namespace that is used, the choice of any particular XML namespace prefix is implementation-specific and not significant for interoperability.
[In Namespaces] The namespace URI of prefix "soap" is http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/, which refers to [SOAP1.1].
[In Namespaces] The namespace URI of prefix "tns" is http://schemas.microsoft.com/exchange/services/2006/messages.
[In Namespaces] The namespace URI of prefix "s" is http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema, which refers to [XMLSCHEMA2].
[In Namespaces] The namespace URI of prefix "wsdl" is http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/,which refers to [WSDL].
[In Namespaces] The namespace URI of prefix "t" is http://schemas.microsoft.com/exchange/services/2006/types.
[In Namespaces] The namespace URI of prefix "m" is http://schemas.microsoft.com/exchange/services/2006/messages.
[In Namespaces] The namespace URI of prefix "xs" is http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema, which refers to [XMLSCHEMA2].
[In Messages] This specification does not define any common WSDL message definitions.
[In Elements] This specification does not define any common XML schema element definitions.

[In Complex Types] The following table summarizes the set of common XML schema complex type definitions that are defined by this specification. [AcceptItemType, AddItemToMyCalendarType ,ArrayOfInboxReminderType ,AttendeeType, CalendarFolderType, CalendarItemType, CalendarPermissionSetType, CalendarPermissionType, CalendarViewType, CancelCalendarItemType, DeclineItemType, MeetingCancellationMessageType, MeetingMessageType, MeetingRegistrationResponseObject ,MeetingRequestMessageType, MeetingResponseMessageType, NonEmptyArrayOfAttendeesType, NonEmptyArrayOfDeletedOccurrencesType, NonEmptyArrayOfOccurrenceInfoType, OccurrenceInfoType, OnlineMeetingSettingsType ,ProposeNewTimeType ,RecurrenceType, RemoveItemType, TentativelyAcceptItemType, TimeChangeType, TimeZoneType]
[In Complex Types] XML schema complex type definitions that are specific to a particular operation are described with the operation.
[In Complex Types] AcceptItemType(section 2.2.4.1): Specifies a response object that is used to accept a meeting invitation or calendar item.
[In Complex Types] AddItemToMyCalendarType (section 2.2.4.2): Specifies a response to a request to add items to the calendar.<1>
[In Complex Types] ArrayOfInboxReminderType (section 2.2.4.3): Specifies an array of inbox reminders.
[In Complex Types]AttendeeType(section 2.2.4.4): Specifies attendees and resources for a meeting.
[In Complex Types] CalendarFolderType(section 2.2.4.5): Specifies a folder that contains calendar items.
[In Complex Types] CalendarItemType(section 2.2.4.6): Specifies a server calendar item.
[In Complex Types] CalendarPermissionSetType(section 2.2.4.7): Defines the access that a user has to a Calendar folder.
[In Complex Types] CalendarPermissionType(section 2.2.4.8): Specifies the access that a user has to a Calendar folder.
[In Complex Types] CalendarViewType(section 2.2.4.9): Specifies the settings that are used to return calendar items in the specified range as they appear in a calendar.
[In Complex Types] CancelCalendarItemType(section 2.2.4.10): Specifies a response object that is used to cancel a meeting.
[In Complex Types] DeclineItemType(section 2.2.4.11): Specifies a response object that is used to decline a meeting invitation or calendar item.
[In Complex Types] EnhancedLocationType (section 2.2.4.12): Specifies additional location information for a calendar item.<2>
[In Complex Types] InboxReminderType (section 2.2.4.13): Specifies an inbox reminder.
[In Complex Types] MeetingCancellationMessageType(section 2.2.4.14): Specifies a meeting cancellation.
[In Complex Types] MeetingMessageType(section 2.2.4.15): Specifies a meeting in the messaging server store.
[In Complex Types] MeetingRegistrationResponseObject (section 2.2.4.16): Specifies a response to a meeting registration request.<3>
[In Complex Types] MeetingRequestMessageType(section 2.2.4.17): Specifies a meeting request in the messaging server store.
[In Complex Types] MeetingResponseMessageType(section 2.2.4.18): Specifies a meeting response in the messaging server store.
[In Complex Types] NonEmptyArrayOfAttendeesType(section 2.2.4.19): Contains a list of attendees and resources for a meeting.
[In Complex Types] NonEmptyArrayOfDeletedOccurrencesType(section 2.2.4.20): Contains a list of deleted occurrences of a recurring meeting request or calendar item.
[In Complex Types] NonEmptyArrayOfOccurrenceInfoType(section 2.2.4.21): Contains a list of modified occurrences of a recurring meeting request or calendar item.
[In Complex Types] OccurrenceInfoType(section 2.2.4.22): Specifies a single occurrence of a recurring meeting request or calendar item.
[In Complex Types] OnlineMeetingSettingsType (section 2.2.4.23): Specifies the settings for an online meeting.<4>
[In Complex Types] ProposeNewTimeType (section 2.2.4.24): Specifies a response to a new time proposal.<5>
[In Complex Types] RecurrenceType(section 2.2.4.25): Specifies the recurrence pattern and recurrence range for calendar items and meeting requests.
[In Complex Types] RemoveItemType(section 2.2.4.26): Specifies a response object that is used to remove a meeting item when a meeting cancellation message is received.
[In Complex Types] TentativelyAcceptItemType(section 2.2.4.27): Specifies a response object that is used to tentatively accept a meeting request invitation or calendar item.
[In Complex Types] TimeChangeType(section 2.2.4.28): Specifies the date and time when the time changes to and from daylight saving time and standard time.
[In Complex Types] TimeZoneType(section 2.2.4.29): MAY<6> specify the time zone of the location where a meeting is hosted.
[In t:AcceptItemType Complex Type] The AcceptItemType: complex type specifies a response object that is used to accept a meeting invitation or calendar item.
[In t:AcceptItemType Complex Type] This complex type extends the MeetingRegistrationResponseObjectType complex type, as specified in section 2.2.4.16.

[In t:AcceptItemType Complex Type] [its schema is] <xs:complexType name="AcceptItemType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="t:MeetingRegistrationResponseObjectType" /> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>
[In t:AddItemToMyCalendarType Complex Type] The AddItemToMyCalendarType complex type specifies a response to a request to add items to the calendar.<7>
[In t:AddItemToMyCalendarType Complex Type] This type [AddItemToMyCalendarType] extends the ResponseObjectType complex type ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.69).

[In t:AddItemToMyCalendarType Complex Type] [its schema is] <xs:complexType name="AddItemToMyCalendarType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="t:ResponseObjectType"/> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>
[In t:ArrayOfInboxReminderType] The ArrayOfInboxReminderType complex type specifies an array of inbox reminders.<8>

[In t:ArrayOfInboxReminderType] [its schema is] <xs:complexType name="ArrayOfInboxReminderType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="InboxReminder" type="t:InboxReminderType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
[In t:ArrayOfInboxReminderType] The following table describes the child element [InboxReminder] of the ArrayOfInboxReminderType complex type.
[In t:ArrayOfInboxReminderType] The type of InboxReminder is t:InboxReminderType (section 2.2.4.13).
[In t:ArrayOfInboxReminderType] InboxReminder: An inbox reminder.
[In t:AttendeeType Complex Type] The AttendeeType complex type specifies attendees and resources for a meeting.

[In t:AttendeeType Complex Type] [its schema is] <xs:complexType name="AttendeeType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Mailbox" type="t:EmailAddressType" /> <xs:element name="ResponseType" type="t:ResponseTypeType" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="LastResponseTime" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="ProposedStart" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="ProposedEnd" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="0" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
[In t:AttendeeType Complex Type] The following table lists the child elements of the AttendeeType complex type. [Mailbox, ResponseType, LastResponseTime]
[In t:AttendeeType Complex Type] The type of Mailbox is t:EmailAddressType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.27).
[In t:AttendeeType Complex Type]Mailbox: Specifies a fully resolved e-mail address.
[In t:AttendeeType Complex Type] The type of ResponseType is t:ResponseTypeType (section 2.2.5.12).
[In t:AttendeeType Complex Type]ResponseType: Specifies the meeting invitation response received for by the meeting organizer from a meeting attendee.
[In t:AttendeeType Complex Type] The type of LastResponseTime is xs:dateTime ([XMLSCHEMA2]).
[In t:AttendeeType Complex Type]LastResponseTime: Specifies the date and time that the latest meeting invitation response was received by the meeting organizer from the meeting attendee.
[In t:AttendeeType Complex Type] The type of ProposedStart is xs:dateTime.
[In t:AttendeeType Complex Type]ProposedStart: The proposed start date and time of the meeting. <9>
[In t:AttendeeType Complex Type] The type of ProposedEnd is xs:dateTime.
[In t:AttendeeType Complex Type]ProposedEnd: The proposed end date and time of the meeting. <10>
[In t:CalendarFolderType Complex Type] The CalendarFolderType complex type specifies a folder that contains calendar items.
[In t:CalendarFolderType Complex Type] This complex type extends the BaseFolderType complex type, as specified in [MS-OXWSFOLD] section 2.2.4.5.

[In t:CalendarFolderType Complex Type] [its schema is] <xs:complexType name="CalendarFolderType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="t:BaseFolderType" > <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="SharingEffectiveRights" type="t:CalendarPermissionReadAccessType" minOccurs="0" /> <xs:element name="PermissionSet" type="t:CalendarPermissionSetType" minOccurs="0" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>
[In t:CalendarFolderType Complex Type] The following table lists the child elements of the CalendarFolderType complex type. [SharingEffectiveRights, PermissionSet]
[In t:CalendarFolderType Complex Type] The type of SharingEffectiveRights is t:CalendarPermissionReadAccessType (section 2.2.5.5).
[In t:CalendarFolderType Complex Type]SharingEffectiveRights: Specifies the permissions a user has to view items in a Calendar folder that is being shared.<11>
[In t:CalendarFolderType Complex Type]SharingEffectiveRights: This element is read-only.
[In t:CalendarFolderType Complex Type] The type of PermissionSet is t:CalendarPermissionSetType (section 2.2.4.7).
[In t:CalendarFolderType Complex Type]PermissionSet: Specifies all permissions that are configured for a Calendar folder.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The CalendarItemType complex type represents a server calendar item.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] This complex type extends the ItemType complex type, as specified in [MS-OXWSCORE] section 2.2.4.8.

[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The following table lists the child elements of the CalendarItemType complex type. [UID, RecurrenceId, DateTimeStamp, Start, End, OriginalStart, IsAllDayEvent, LegacyFreeBusyStatus, Location, When, IsMeeting, IsCancelled, IsRecurring, MeetingRequestWasSent, IsResponseRequested, CalendarItemType, MyResponseType, Organizer, RequiredAttendees, OptionalAttendees, Resources, ConflictingMeetingCount, AdjacentMeetingCount, ConflictingMeetings, AdjacentMeetings, Duration, TimeZone, AppointmentReplyTime, AppointmentSequenceNumber, AppointmentState, Recurrence, FirstOccurrence, LastOccurrence, ModifiedOccurrences, DeletedOccurrences, MeetingTimeZone, StartTimeZone, EndTimeZone, ConferenceType, AllowNewTimeProposal, IsOnlineMeeting, MeetingWorkspaceUrl, NetShowUrl, EnhancedLocation, StartWallClock, EndWallClock, StartTimeZoneId, EndTimeZoneId, IntendedFreeBusyStatus, JoinOnlineMeetingUrl, OnlineMeetingSettings]
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of UID is xs:string ([XMLSCHEMA2]).
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] UID: Contains the unique identifier for the calendar item.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of RecurrenceId is xs:dateTime ([XMLSCHEMA2]).
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] RecurrenceId: Specifies a specific instance of a recurring calendar item.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of DateTimeStamp is xs:dateTime.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] DateTimeStamp: Specifies the date and time that the calendar item was created.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of Start is xs:dateTime.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] Start: Specifies the start date and time of a duration.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of End is xs:dateTime.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] End: Specifies the end date and time of a duration.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of OriginalStart is xs:dateTime.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] OriginalStart: Represents the original start time of a calendar item (only for occurrences/exceptions).
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of IsAllDayEvent is xs:boolean ([XMLSCHEMA2]).
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] IsAllDayEvent: Indicates whether a calendar item or meeting request represents an all-day event.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [IsAllDayEvent is] True if a calendar item or meeting request represents an all-day event.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] otherwise [if calendar item or meeting request does not represent an all-day event], [IsAllDayEvent is] false.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of LegacyFreeBusyStatus is t:LegacyFreeBusyType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.3.17)
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] LegacyFreeBusyStatus: Specifies the free/busy status of the calendar item.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXWSMTGS_R16500, MS-OXWSMTGS_R16501, MS-OXWSMTGS_R16502, MS-OXWSMTGS_R16503, MS-OXWSMTGS_R16504.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The LegacyFreeBusyStatus which value is "Busy" specifies the status as busy.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The LegacyFreeBusyStatus which value is "Free" specifies the status as free.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The LegacyFreeBusyStatus which value is "NoData" specifies that there is no data for that recipient.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The LegacyFreeBusyStatus which value is "OOF" specifies the status as Out of Office (OOF).
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The LegacyFreeBusyStatus which value is "Tentative" specifies the status as tentative.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of Location is xs:string.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] Location: Specifies the location of a meeting or appointment.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of When is xs:string.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] When: Provides information about when a calendar or meeting item occurs.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [When] is not populated to attendee's mailbox.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of IsMeeting is xs:boolean.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] IsMeeting: Indicates whether the calendar item is a meeting or appointment.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [IsMeeting is] True if the calendar item is a meeting or appointment.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] otherwise [if the calendar item is not a meeting or appointment], [IsMeeting is] false.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type][IsMeeting] This element is not valid if CalendarItemType is contained in a CreateItem request, as specified in section 3.1.4.2.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of IsCancelled is xs:boolean.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] IsCancelled: Indicates whether a meeting has been canceled.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [IsCancelled is] True if a meeting has been canceled.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] otherwise [if a meeting has not been canceled], [IsCancelled is] false.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of IsRecurring is xs:boolean.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] IsRecurring: Indicates whether a calendar item is part of a recurring item.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [IsRecurring is] True, if a calendar item is part of a recurring item.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] otherwise [if a calendar item is not part of a recurring item], [IsRecurring is] false.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of MeetingRequestWasSent is xs:boolean.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] MeetingRequestWasSent: Indicates whether a meeting request has been sent to requested attendees, including required and optional attendees, and resources.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [MeetingRequestWasSent is] True, if meeting request has been sent to requested attendees, including required and optional attendees, and resources.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] otherwise [if request has not been sent to requested attendees, including required and optional attendees, and resources], [MeetingRequestWasSent is] false.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of IsResponseRequested is xs:boolean.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] IsResponseRequested: Indicates whether a response to an item is requested.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [IsResponseRequested is] True, if a response to an item is requested.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] otherwise [if a response to an item is not requested], [IsResponseRequested is] false.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of CalendarItemType is t:CalendarItemTypeType.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] CalendarItemType: Specifies the occurrence type of a calendar item.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of MyResponseType is t:ResponseTypeType (section 2.2.5.12).
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] MyResponseType: Specifies the status of the response to a calendar item.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of Organizer is t:SingleRecipientType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.60).

[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] When the Mailbox element of Organizer element include an EmailAddress element of t:NonEmptyStringType, the t:NonEmptyStringType simple type specifies a string that MUST have a minimum of one character.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] Organizer: Specifies the organizer of a meeting.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of RequiredAttendees is t:NonEmptyArrayOfAttendeesType (section 2.2.4.19)
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] RequiredAttendees: Specifies attendees that are required to attend a meeting.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of OptionalAttendees is t:NonEmptyArrayOfAttendeesType.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] OptionalAttendees: Specifies attendees who are not required to attend a meeting.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of Resources is t:NonEmptyArrayOfAttendeesType.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] Resources: Specifies a scheduled resource for a meeting and is not populated to attendee's mailbox.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of ConflictingMeetingCount is xs:int ([XMLSCHEMA2]).
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] ConflictingMeetingCount: Specifies the number of meetings that conflict with the calendar item.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of AdjacentMeetingCount is xs:int.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] AdjacentMeetingCount: Indicates the total number of calendar items that are adjacent to a meeting time.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of ConflictingMeetings is t:NonEmptyArrayOfAllItemsType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.48).
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] ConflictingMeetings: Indicates all calendar items that conflict with a meeting time.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of AdjacentMeetings is t:NonEmptyArrayOfAllItemsType.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] AdjacentMeetings: Indicates all calendar items that are adjacent to a meeting time.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of Duration is xs:string.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] Duration: Specifies the duration of a calendar item.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of TimeZone is xs:string.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] TimeZone: Specifies a text description of a time zone.<12>
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of AppointmentReplyTime is xs:dateTime.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] AppointmentReplyTime: Specifies the date and time that an attendee replied to a meeting request.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of AppointmentSequenceNumber is xs:int.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] AppointmentSequenceNumber: Specifies the sequence number of a version of an appointment.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of AppointmentState is xs:int.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] AppointmentState: Specifies the status of the appointment.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] AppointmentState: Valid values include: 0 (zero): the calendar item represents an appointment
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [AppointmentState: Valid values include:] 1: the calendar item on the organizer's calendar represents a meeting
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [AppointmentState: Valid values include:] 3: the meeting request corresponding to the calendar item has been received
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [AppointmentState: Valid values include:] 5: the meeting corresponding to the organizer's calendar item has been cancelled
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [AppointmentState: Valid values include:] This value [5] is found in the Deleted Items folder of the organizer.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [AppointmentState: Valid values include:] 7: the meeting corresponding to the attendee's calendar item has been cancelled
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of Recurrence is t:RecurrenceType (section 2.2.4.25).
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type]Recurrence: Specifies the recurrence pattern and the recurrence range for calendar items and meeting requests.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of FirstOccurrence is t:OccurrenceInfoType (section 2.2.4.22).
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type]FirstOccurrence: Specifies the first occurrence of a recurring calendar item.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of LastOccurrence is t:OccurrenceInfoType.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type]LastOccurrence: Specifies the last occurrence of a recurring calendar item.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of ModifiedOccurrences is t:NonEmptyArrayOfOccurrenceInfoType (section 2.2.4.21).

[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type]ModifiedOccurrences: Specifies recurring calendar item occurrences that have been modified so that they differ from original occurrences (or instances of the recurring master item).
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of DeletedOccurrences is t:NonEmptyArrayOfDeletedOccurrencesType (section 2.2.4.20).
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type]DeletedOccurrences: Specifies deleted occurrences of a recurring calendar item.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [The complex type "MeetingTimeZone" with type "t:TimeZoneType (section 2.2.4.24)"]: MAY<13> specify the time zone of the location where the meeting is hosted.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] This element [MeetingTimeZone] is returned only if the value of the CalendarItemType element is RecurringMaster.

[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [The complex type "StartTimeZone" with type "t:TimeZoneDefinitionType ([MS-OXWSGTZ] section 2.2.4.12)"]: SHOULD<14> specify the calendar item start time zone information.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [The complex type "EndTimeZone" with type "t:TimeZoneDefinitionType"]: SHOULD<15> specify the calendar item end time zone information.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of ConferenceType is xs:int.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type]ConferenceType: Specifies the type of conferencing that is performed with a calendar item.<16>
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] ConferenceType: Valid values include: 0 (zero): video conference
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [ConferenceType: Valid values include:] 1: presentation
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [ConferenceType: Valid values include:] 2: chat
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of AllowNewTimeProposal is xs:boolean.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] AllowNewTimeProposal: Indicates whether a new meeting time can be proposed for a meeting by an attendee.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [AllowNewTimeProposal is] True, if a new meeting time can be proposed for a meeting by an attendee.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] otherwise [if a new meeting time can not be proposed for a meeting by an attendee], [AllowNewTimeProposal is] false.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of IsOnlineMeeting is xs:boolean.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] IsOnlineMeeting: Indicates whether the meeting is online.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [IsOnlineMeeting is] True, if the meeting is online.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] otherwise [if the meeting is not online], [IsOnlineMeeting is] false.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type][ IsOnlineMeeting]This element is read-only.<17>
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of MeetingWorkspaceUrl is xs:string.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] MeetingWorkspaceUrl: Contains the URL for the Meeting Workspace that is included in the calendar item.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of NetShowUrl is xs:string.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] NetShowUrl: Specifies the URL for an online meeting.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [The complex type "EnhancedLocation" with type "EnhancedLocationType (section 2.2.4.12)"]: Specifies additional location information for the calendar item.<18>
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [The complex type "StartWallClock" with type "xs:dateTime"]: Specifies the start time of the calendar item.<19>
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [The complex type "EndWallClock" with type "xs:dateTime"]: Specifies the ending time of the calendar item.<20>
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [The complex type "StartTimeZoneId" with type "xs:string"]: Specifies the calendar item start time zone identifier.<21>
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [The complex type "EndTimeZoneId" with type "xs:string"]: Specifies the calendar item end time zone identifier.<22>

[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [The complex type "IntendedFreeBusyStatus" with type "LegacyFreeBusyType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.3.17)"]: Indicates how the organizer of the meeting wants it to show up in the attendee's calendar when the meeting is accepted. <23>
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [The complex type "JoinOnlineMeetingUrl" with type "xs:string"]: Specifies the URL for joining the online meeting.<24>
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [JoinOnlineMeetingUrl]This element is ignored by the server.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [The complex type "OnlineMeetingSettings" with type "OnlineMeetingSettingsType"]: Specifies settings for online meetings.<25>
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [OnlineMeetingSettings]This element is ignored by the server.
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [The complex type "IsOrganizer" with type "xs:boolean"]: Specifies whether the current user is the organizer and/or owner of the calendar item.<26>
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] The type of complex type "InboxReminders" is "t:ArrayOfInboxReminderType (section 2.2.4.3)".
[In t:CalendarItemType Complex Type] [The complex type "InboxReminders" with type "t:ArrayOfInboxReminderType (section 2.2.4.3)"]: Specifies Inbox reminders.
[In t:CalendarPermissionSetType Complex Type] The CalendarPermissionSetType complex type defines the access that a user has to a Calendar folder.

[In t:CalendarPermissionSetType Complex Type] [its schema is] <xs:complexType name="CalendarPermissionSetType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="CalendarPermissions" type="t:ArrayOfCalendarPermissionsType" /> <xs:element name="UnknownEntries" type="t:ArrayOfUnknownEntriesType" minOccurs="0" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
[In t:CalendarPermissionSetType Complex Type] The following table lists the child elements of the CalendarPermissionSetType complex type. [CalendarPermissions, UnknownEntries]
[In t:CalendarPermissionSetType Complex Type] The type of CalendarPermissions is t:ArrayofCalendarPermissionsType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.4).
[In t:CalendarPermissionSetType Complex Type] CalendarPermissions: Contains an array of calendar permissions for a folder.
[In t:CalendarPermissionSetType Complex Type] The type of UnknownEntries is t:ArrayOfUnknownEntriesType ([MS-OXWSFOLD] section 2.2.4.4).
[In t:CalendarPermissionSetType Complex Type] UnknownEntries: Contains an array of unknown permission entries that cannot be resolved against the directory service.
[In t:CalendarPermissionType Complex Type] The CalendarPermissionType complex type specifies the access that a user has to a Calendar folder.
[In t:CalendarPermissionType Complex Type] This complex type extends the BasePermissionType complex type, as specified in [MS-OXWSFOLD] section 2.2.4.3.

[In t:CalendarPermissionType Complex Type] [its schema is] <xs:complexType name="CalendarPermissionType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="t:BasePermissionType" > <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="ReadItems" type="t:CalendarPermissionReadAccessType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" /> <xs:element name="CalendarPermissionLevel" type="t:CalendarPermissionLevelType" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>
[In t:CalendarPermissionType Complex Type] The following table lists the child elements of the CalendarPermissionType complex type. [ReadItems, CalendarPermissionLevel]
[In t:CalendarPermissionType Complex Type] The type of ReadItems is t:CalendarPermissionReadAccessType (section 2.2.5.5).
[In t:CalendarPermissionType Complex Type] ReadItems: Specifies the permissions a user has to view items in a Calendar folder.
[In t:CalendarPermissionType Complex Type] The type of CalendarPermissionLevel is t:CalendarPermissionLevelType (section 2.2.5.4).
[In t:CalendarPermissionType Complex Type]CalendarPermissionLevel: Specifies the permission level that a user has on a Calendar folder.
[In t:CalendarPermissionType Complex Type] CalendarPermissionLevel: This element MUST exist if calendar permissions are set on a Calendar folder.
[In t:CalendarViewType Complex Type] The CalendarViewType complex type represents the settings that are used to return calendar items in the specified range as they appear in a calendar.
[In t:CalendarViewType Complex Type] This complex type extends the BasePagingType complex type, as specified in [MS-OXWSSRCH] section 2.2.4.5.

[In t:CalendarViewType Complex Type] [its schema is] <xs:complexType name="CalendarViewType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="t:BasePagingType" > <xs:attribute name="StartDate" type="xs:dateTime" use="required" /> <xs:attribute name="EndDate" type="xs:dateTime" use="required" /> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>
[In t:CalendarViewType Complex Type] The following table lists the attributes of the CalendarViewType complex type. [StartDate, EndDate]
[In t:CalendarViewType Complex Type] The type of StartDate is xs:dateTime ([XMLSCHEMA2]).
[In t:CalendarViewType Complex Type]StartDate: Contains the start of the time span for a Calendar view.
[In t:CalendarViewType Complex Type] The type of EndDate is xs:dateTime.
[In t:CalendarViewType Complex Type] EndDate: Contains the end of the time span for a Calendar view.
[In t:CancelCalendarItemType Complex Type] The CancelCalendarItemType complex type specifies a response object used to cancel a meeting.
[In t:CancelCalendarItemType Complex Type] This complex type extends the SmartResponseType complex type, as specified in [MS-OXWSCORE] section 2.2.4.22.

[In t:CancelCalendarItemType Complex Type] [its schema is] <xs:complexType name="CancelCalendarItemType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="t:SmartResponseType" /> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>
[In t:DeclineItemType Complex Type] The DeclineItemType complex type specifies a response object that is used to decline a meeting invitation or calendar item.
[In t:DeclineItemType Complex Type] This complex type extends the MeetingRegistrationResponseObjectType complex type, as specified section 2.2.4.16.

[In t:DeclineItemType Complex Type] [its schema is] <xs:complexType name="DeclineItemType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="t:MeetingRegistrationResponseObjectType" /> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>

[In t:EnhancedLocationType Complex Type] The EnhancedLocationType complex type specifies additional location information for a calendar item.<27> <xs:complexType name="EnhancedLocationType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="DisplayName" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="Annotation" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="PostalAddress" type="t:PersonaPostalAddressType" minOccurs="0"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
[In t:EnhancedLocationType Complex Type] DisplayName: An element of type string, as defined in [XMLSCHEMA2] section 3.2.1, that represents the display name of the calendar item.
[In t:EnhancedLocationType Complex Type] Annotation: An element of type string that represents a note on the calendar item.

[In t:EnhancedLocationType Complex Type] PostalAddress: An element of type PersonaPostalAddressType, as defined in [MS-OXWSPERS] section 2.2.4.18, that represents the postal address of the individual associated with a persona.
[In t:InboxReminderType] The InboxReminderType complex type specifies an inbox reminder.<28>

[In t:InboxReminderType] [its schema is] <xs:complexType name="InboxReminderType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Id" type="t:GuidType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="ReminderOffset" type="xs:int" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="Message" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="IsOrganizerReminder" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="OccurrenceChange" type="t:EmailReminderChangeType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="IsImportedFromOLC" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="SendOption" type="t:EmailReminderSendOption" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
[In t:InboxReminderType] The type of Id is t:GuidType ([XMLSCHEMA2] ).
[In t:InboxReminderType] Id: The identifier for this reminder.
[In t:InboxReminderType] The type of ReminderOffset is xs:int ([XMLSCHEMA2] ).
[In t:InboxReminderType] ReminderOffset: The offset from the start of the meeting in minutes.
[In t:InboxReminderType] The type of Message is xs:string ([XMLSCHEMA2] ).
[In t:InboxReminderType] Message: The custom message to send when the reminder is triggered.
[In t:InboxReminderType] The type of IsOrganizerReminder is xs:boolean ([XMLSCHEMA2] ).
[In t:InboxReminderType] IsOrganizerReminder: Specifies whether this is an organizer inbox reminder.
[In t:InboxReminderType] True [Specifies this [IsOrganizerReminder] is an organizer inbox reminder.]
[In t:InboxReminderType] False [Specifies this [IsOrganizerReminder] is not an organizer inbox reminder.]
[In t:InboxReminderType] The type of OccurrenceChange t:EmailReminderChangeType (section 2.2.5.6).
[In t:InboxReminderType] OccurrenceChange: Specifies how this reminder has been modified for an occurrence
[In t:InboxReminderType] The type of IsImportedFromOLC is xs:boolean.
[In t:InboxReminderType] IsImportedFromOLC: Specifies whether this reminder is imported from Microsoft Outlook.
[In t:InboxReminderType] [IsImportedFromOLC is] true if this is imported from Microsoft Outlook.
[In t:InboxReminderType] otherwise [if this is imported from Microsoft Outlook], [IsImportedFromOLC is] false.
[In t:InboxReminderType] The type of SendOption is t:EmailReminderSendOption (section 2.2.5.7).
[In t:InboxReminderType] SendOption: Specifies the send option.
[In t:MeetingCancellationMessageType Complex Type] The MeetingCancellationMessageType complex type represents a meeting cancellation.
[In t:MeetingCancellationMessageType Complex Type] This type extends the MeetingMessageType complex type, as specified in section 2.2.4.15.

[In t:MeetingCancellationMessageType Complex Type] [Its schema is] <xs:complexType name="MeetingCancellationMessageType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="t:MeetingMessageType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Start" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="End" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="Location" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="Recurrence" type="t:RecurrenceType" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="CalendarItemType" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="EnhancedLocation" type="t:EnhancedLocationType" minOccurs="0"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>
[In t:MeetingCancellationMessageType Complex Type] Start:An element of type dateTime, as defined in [XMLSCHEMA2] section 3.2.7, that represents the start time of the calendar item.<29>
[In t:MeetingCancellationMessageType Complex Type] End: An element of type dateTime that represents the ending time of the calendar item.<30>
[In t:MeetingCancellationMessageType Complex Type] Location: An element of type string, as defined in [XMLSCHEMA2] section 3.2.1, that represents the location of the calendar item.<31>
[In t:MeetingCancellationMessageType Complex Type] Recurrence: An element of type RecurrenceType, as defined in section 2.2.4.25, that represents the recurrence of the calendar item.<32>
[In t:MeetingCancellationMessageType Complex Type] CalendarItemType: An element of type string that represents the type of calendar item.<33>

[In t:MeetingCancellationMessageType Complex Type] EnhancedLocation: An element of type EnhancedLocationType, as defined in section 2.2.4.12, that specifies additional location information for a calendar item.

[In t:MeetingMessageType Complex Type] The type of AssociatedCalendarItemId is t:ItemIdType ([MS-OXWSCORE] section 2.2.4.19).
[In t:MeetingMessageType Complex Type] AssociatedCalendarItemId: Represents an item identifier of the corresponding calendar item in a messaging server mailbox.
[In t:MeetingMessageType Complex Type] The type of IsDelegated is xs:boolean ([XMLSCHEMA2]).
[In t:MeetingMessageType Complex Type] IsDelegated: Indicates whether a meeting message belongs to a mailbox of an account that has delegate access , as specified in [MS-OXWSDLGM].
[In t:MeetingMessageType Complex Type][IsDelegated is] True, if a meeting message belongs to a mailbox of an account that has delegate access.
[In t:MeetingMessageType Complex Type]otherwise [if a meeting message not belong to a mailbox of an account that has delegate access], [IsDelegated is] false.
[In t:MeetingMessageType Complex Type] The type of IsOutOfDate is xs:boolean.
[In t:MeetingMessageType Complex Type] IsOutOfDate: Indicates that there has been an update to the meeting and the current item in the calendar is out of date.
[In t:MeetingMessageType Complex Type] [IsOutOfDate is] True, there has been an update to the meeting and the current item in the calendar is out of date.
[In t:MeetingMessageType Complex Type] otherwise [ there has not been an update to the meeting and the current item in the calendar is not out of date] false.
[In t:MeetingMessageType Complex Type] The type of HasBeenProcessed is xs:boolean.
[In t:MeetingMessageType Complex Type] HasBeenProcessed: Indicates whether a meeting message item has been processed.
[In t:MeetingMessageType Complex Type] The type of ResponseType is t:ResponseTypeType (section 2.2.5.12).
[In t:MeetingMessageType Complex Type] ResponseType: Represents the type of recipient (1) response that is received for a meeting. <34>
[In t:MeetingMessageType Complex Type] The type of UID is xs:string ([XMLSCHEMA2]).
[In t:MeetingMessageType Complex Type] UID: Identifies a meeting message.
[In t:MeetingMessageType Complex Type] The type of RecurrenceId is xs:dateTime ([XMLSCHEMA2]).
[In t:MeetingMessageType Complex Type] RecurrenceId: Identifies a specific instance of a recurring calendar item.
[In t:MeetingMessageType Complex Type] The type of DateTimeStamp is xs:dateTime.
[In t:MeetingMessageType Complex Type] DateTimeStamp: Indicates the date and time that an instance of a Calendar object was created.
[In t:MeetingMessageType Complex Type] The type of IsOrganizer is xs:boolean ([XMLSCHEMA2]).
[In t:MeetingMessageType Complex Type] IsOrganizer: Specifies whether the current user is the organizer of the meeting.<35>

ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirements: MS-OXWSMTGS_R28500, MS-OXWSMTGS_R28501, MS-OXWSMTGS_R28502, MS-OXWSMTGS_R28503, MS-OXWSMTGS_R28504.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The IntendedFreeBusyStatus which value is "Busy" specifies the status as busy.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The IntendedFreeBusyStatus which value is "Free" specifies the status as free.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The IntendedFreeBusyStatus which value is "NoData" specifies that there is no data for that recipient.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The IntendedFreeBusyStatus which value is "OOF" specifies the status as Out of Office (OOF).
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The IntendedFreeBusyStatus which value is "Tentative" specifies the status as tentative.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of Start is xs:dateTime ([XMLSCHEMA2])
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] Start: Represents the start time of the meeting.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of End is xs:dateTime.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] End: Specifies the end of the duration for a single occurrence of a meeting.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of OriginalStart is xs:dateTime.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] OriginalStart: Specifies the original start time for the meeting item (only for occurrences/exceptions).
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of IsAllDayEvent is xs:boolean ([XMLSCHEMA2]).
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] IsAllDayEvent: Specifies whether the meeting is an all-day event.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] [IsAllDayEvent is] True, if the meeting is an all-day event.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] otherwise [if the meeting is not an all-day event], [IsAllDayEvent is] false.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of LegacyFreeBusyStatus is t:LegacyFreeBusyType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.3.17).
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] LegacyFreeBusyStatus: Represents the free/busy status of the meeting item.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] This element [LegacyFreeBusyStatus] is not used.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of Location is xs:string ([XMLSCHEMA2]).
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] Location: Represents the location of the meeting.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of When is xs:string.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] When: Provides information about when the meeting occurs and is not populated to attendee's mailbox.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of IsMeeting is xs:boolean.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] IsMeeting: Indicates whether the calendar item is a meeting or an appointment.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] [IsMeeting is] True, if the calendar item is a meeting or an appointment.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] otherwise [if the calendar item is not a meeting or an appointment], [IsMeeting is] false.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type]This element [IsMeeting] is "true".
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of IsCancelled is xs:boolean.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] IsCancelled: Indicates whether the meeting has been cancelled.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] [IsCancelled is] True, if the meeting has been cancelled.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] otherwise [if the meeting has not been cancelled], [IsCancelled is] false.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of IsRecurring is xs:boolean.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] IsRecurring: Indicates whether the meeting is part of a recurring series of meetings.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] [IsRecurring is] True, if the meeting is part of a recurring series of meetings.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] otherwise [if the meeting is not part of a recurring series of meetings], [IsRecurring is] false.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of MeetingRequestWasSent is xs:boolean.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] MeetingRequestWasSent: Indicates whether a meeting request has been sent to requested attendees.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] [MeetingRequestWasSent is] True, if a meeting request has been sent to requested attendees.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type]This element [MeetingRequestWasSent] is "true".
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of CalendarItemType is t:CalendarItemTypeType.(section 2.2.4.6)
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] CalendarItemType: Represents the occurrence type of a meeting item.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of MyResponseType is t:ResponseTypeType (section 2.2.5.12).
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] MyResponseType: Identifies the type of the response to the meeting request (sent for the organizer's meeting item).
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of Organizer is t:SingleRecipientType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.60).
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] Organizer: Represents the organizer of the meeting.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of RequiredAttendees is t:NonEmptyArrayOfAttendeesType (section 2.2.4.19).
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] RequiredAttendees: Represents attendees that are required to attend the meeting.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of OptionalAttendees is t:NonEmptyArrayOfAttendeesType.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] OptionalAttendees: Represents attendees who are not required to attend the meeting.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of Resources is t:NonEmptyArrayOfAttendeesType.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] Resources: Represents a scheduled resource for the meeting and is not populated to attendee's mailbox.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of ConflictingMeetingCount is xs:int ([XMLSCHEMA2]).
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] ConflictingMeetingCount: Represents the number of calendar items that conflict with the meeting item.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of AdjacentMeetingCount is xs:int.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] AdjacentMeetingCount: Represents the total number of calendar items that are adjacent to the meeting time.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of ConflictingMeetings is t:NonEmptyArrayOfAllItemsType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.42)
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] ConflictingMeetings: Identifies all calendar items that conflict with the meeting time.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of AdjacentMeetings is t:NonEmptyArrayOfAllItemsType.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] AdjacentMeetings: Identifies all calendar items that are adjacent to the meeting time.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of Duration is xs:string.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] Duration: Represents the duration of the meeting.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of TimeZone is xs:string.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] TimeZone: Provides a text description of a time zone.<37>
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of AppointmentReplyTime is xs:dateTime.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] AppointmentReplyTime: Represents the date and time that an attendee replied to a meeting request.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of AppointmentSequenceNumber is xs:int.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] AppointmentSequenceNumber: Specifies the sequence number of a version of an appointment.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of AppointmentState is xs:int.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] AppointmentState: Specifies the status of the appointment.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] [AppointmentState's] Valid values include: 3: the organizer's meeting request has been sent; the attendee's meeting request has been received
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of Recurrence is t:RecurrenceType (section 2.2.4.25).
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] Recurrence: Contains the recurrence pattern for meeting items and meeting requests.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of FirstOccurrence is t:OccurrenceInfoType (section 2.2.4.22).
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] FirstOccurrence: Represents the first occurrence of a recurring meeting item.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of LastOccurrence is t:OccurrenceInfoType.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] LastOccurrence: Represents the last occurrence of a recurring meeting item.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of ModifiedOccurrences is t:NonEmptyArrayOfOccurrenceInfoType (section 2.2.4.21).

[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] ModifiedOccurrences: Contains an array of recurring meeting item occurrences that have been modified so that they are different from the original instances of the recurrence master item.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of DeletedOccurrences is t:NonEmptyArrayOfDeletedOccurrencesType (section 2.2.4.20).
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] DeletedOccurrences: Contains an array of deleted occurrences of a recurring meeting item.

[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] [The complex type "MeetingTimeZone" with type "t:TimeZoneType (section 2.2.4.29)"]: MAY<38> specify the time zone of the location where the meeting is hosted.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] This element [MeetingTimeZone] is returned only if the value of the CalendarItemType element is RecurringMaster.

[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] [The complex type "StartTimeZone" with type "t:TimeZoneDefinitionType ([MS-OXWSGTZ] section 2.2.4.12)"]: SHOULD<39> specify the time zone for the start of the meeting item.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] [The complex type "EndTimeZone" with type "t:TimeZoneDefinitionType"]: SHOULD<40> specify the time zone for the end of the meeting item.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of ConferenceType is xs:int.

[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] ConferenceType: Describes the type of conferencing that is performed with the meeting item.<41> Valid values include: 0 (zero): video conference 1: presentation 2: chat
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The value of "ConferenceType" is "0" (zero) describes the type of conferencing is video conference
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The value of "ConferenceType" is "1" describes the type of conferencing is presentation
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The value of "ConferenceType" is "2" describes the type of conferencing is chat
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of AllowNewTimeProposal is xs:boolean.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] AllowNewTimeProposal: Indicates whether a new meeting time can be proposed for the meeting by an attendee.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] [AllowNewTimeProposal is] True, if a new meeting time can be proposed for the meeting by an attendee.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] otherwise [if a new meeting time can not be proposed for the meeting by an attendee], [AllowNewTimeProposal is] false.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of IsOnlineMeeting is xs:boolean.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] IsOnlineMeeting: Indicates whether the meeting is online.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] [IsOnlineMeeting is] True, if the meeting is online.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] otherwise [if the meeting is not online], [IsOnlineMeeting is] false.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of MeetingWorkspaceUrl is xs:string.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] MeetingWorkspaceUrl: Contains the URL for the Meeting Workspace that is included in the meeting item.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of NetShowUrl is xs:string.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] NetShowUrl: Specifies the URL for an online meeting.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] [The complex type "EnhancedLocation" with type "EnhancedLocationType (section 2.2.4.12)"]: Specifies additional location information.<42>
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] The type of ChangeHighlights is ChangeHighlightsType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.21).
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] ChangeHighlights: Specifies the changes made to a meeting when a meeting update occurs.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] When the ChangeHighlights' child element "HasLocationChanged" with type xs:boolean set to "True", it specifies the meeting location has changed.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] When the ChangeHighlights' child element "HasLocationChanged" with type xs:boolean set to "False", specifies the meeting location has no changed.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] When the ChangeHighlights' child element "HasStartTimeChanged" with type xs:boolean set to "True", specifies the meeting start time has changed.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] When the ChangeHighlights' child element "HasStartTimeChanged" with type xs:boolean set to "False" specifies the meeting start time has no changed.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] When the ChangeHighlights' child element "HasEndTimeChanged" with type xs:boolean set to "True", specifies the meeting end time has changed.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] When the ChangeHighlights' child element "HasEndTimeChanged" with type xs:boolean set to "False", it specifies the meeting end time has no changed.
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] [The complex type "StartWallClock"with type "xs:dateTime"]: Specifies the start time of the calendar item.<43>
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] [The complex type "EndWallClock" with type "xs:dateTime"]: Specifies the ending time of the calendar item.<44>
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] [The complex type "StartTimeZoneId" with type "xs:string"]: Specifies the start time zone identifier.<45>
[In t:MeetingRequestMessageType Complex Type] [The complex type "EndTimeZoneId" with type "xs:string"]: Specifies the end time zone identifier.<46>
[In t:MeetingResponseMessageType Complex Type] The MeetingResponseMessageType complex type represents a meeting response in the messaging server store.

[In t:MeetingResponseMessageType Complex Type] The server creates this type [MeetingResponseMessageType] in the organizer's Inbox folder when an attendee accepts, tentatively accepts, or declines a request created by the CreateItem operation, as specified in section 3.1.4.2.
[In t:MeetingResponseMessageType Complex Type] This type extends the MeetingMessageType complex type, as specified in section 2.2.4.15.

[In t:MeetingResponseMessageType Complex Type] [Its schema is] <xs:complexType name="MeetingResponseMessageType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="t:MeetingMessageType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Start" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="End" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="Location" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="Recurrence" type="t:RecurrenceType" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="CalendarItemType" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="ProposedStart" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="ProposedEnd" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="0"/> <xs:element name="EnhancedLocation" type="t:EnhancedLocationType" minOccurs="0"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>
[In t:MeetingResponseMessageType Complex Type] Start: An element of type dateTime, as defined in [XMLSCHEMA2] section 3.2.7, that represents the start time of the calendar item.<47>
[In t:MeetingResponseMessageType Complex Type] End: An element of type dateTime that represents the ending time of the calendar item.<48>
[In t:MeetingResponseMessageType Complex Type] Location: An element of type string, as defined in [XMLSCHEMA2] section 3.2.1, that represents the location for the calendar item.<49>
[In t:MeetingResponseMessageType Complex Type] Recurrence: An element of type RecurrenceType, as defined in section 2.2.4.20, that represents the recurrence for the calendar item.<50>
[In t:MeetingResponseMessageType Complex Type] CalendarItemType: An element of type string that represents the type of calendar item.<51>
[In t:MeetingResponseMessageType Complex Type] ProposedStart: An element of type dateTime that represents the proposed start time of the calendar item.<52>
[In t:MeetingResponseMessageType Complex Type] ProposedEnd: An element of type dateTime that represents the proposed end time of the calendar item.<53>

[In t:MeetingResponseMessageType Complex Type] EnhancedLocation: An element of type EnhancedLocationType, as defined in section 2.2.4.12, that represents additional location information for the calendar item.<54>
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfAttendeesType Complex Type] The NonEmptyArrayOfAttendeesType complex type contains a list representing attendees and resources for a meeting.

[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfAttendeesType Complex Type] [its schema is] <xs:complexType name="NonEmptyArrayOfAttendeesType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Attendee" type="t:AttendeeType" maxOccurs="unbounded" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfAttendeesType Complex Type] The following table lists the child element of the NonEmptyArrayOfAttendeesType complex type. [Attendee]
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfAttendeesType Complex Type] The type of Attendee type is t:AttendeeType (section 2.2.4.4).
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfAttendeesType Complex Type] Attendee: Represents an attendee or resource for a meeting.

[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfDeletedOccurrencesType Complex Type] The NonEmptyArrayOfDeletedOccurrencesType complex type contains a list of deleted occurrences of a recurring calendar item or meeting request.

[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfDeletedOccurrencesType Complex Type] [its schema is] <xs:complexType name="NonEmptyArrayOfDeletedOccurrencesType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="DeletedOccurrence" type="t:DeletedOccurrenceInfoType" maxOccurs="unbounded" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfDeletedOccurrencesType Complex Type] The following table lists the child element of the NonEmptyArrayOfDeletedOccurrencesType complex type. [DeletedOccurrence]
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfDeletedOccurrencesType Complex Type] The type of DeletedOccurrence is t:DeletedOccurrenceInfoType ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.22).
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfDeletedOccurrencesType Complex Type] DeletedOccurrence: Represents a deleted occurrence of a recurring calendar item.
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfOccurrenceInfoType Complex Type] The NonEmptyArrayOfOccurrenceInfoType complex type contains a list of modified occurrences of a recurring calendar item or meeting request.

[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfOccurrenceInfoType Complex Type] [its schema is] <xs:complexType name="NonEmptyArrayOfOccurrenceInfoType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Occurrence" type="t:OccurrenceInfoType" maxOccurs="unbounded" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfOccurrenceInfoType Complex Type] The following table lists the child element of the NonEmptyArrayOfOccurrenceInfoType complex type. [Occurrence]
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfOccurrenceInfoType Complex Type] The type of Occurrence is t:OccurrenceInfoType (section 2.2.4.22).
[In t:NonEmptyArrayOfOccurrenceInfoType Complex Type] Occurrence: Represents a modified occurrence of a recurring calendar item.
[In t:OccurrenceInfoType Complex Type] The OccurrenceInfoType complex type represents a single occurrence of a recurring calendar item or meeting request.

[In t:OccurrenceInfoType Complex Type] [its schema is] <xs:complexType name="OccurrenceInfoType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="ItemId" type="t:ItemIdType" /> <xs:element name="Start" type="xs:dateTime" /> <xs:element name="End" type="xs:dateTime" /> <xs:element name="OriginalStart" type="xs:dateTime" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
[In t:OccurrenceInfoType Complex Type] The following table lists the child elements of the OccurrenceInfoType complex type. [ItemId, Start, End, OriginalStart]
[In t:OccurrenceInfoType Complex Type] The type of ItemId is t:ItemIdType ([MS-OXWSCORE] section 2.2.4.19).
[In t:OccurrenceInfoType Complex Type] ItemId: Contains the identifier of a modified occurrence of a recurring calendar item.
[In t:OccurrenceInfoType Complex Type] The type of Start is xs:dateTime ([XMLSCHEMA2]).
[In t:OccurrenceInfoType Complex Type] Start: Contains the start time of a modified occurrence of a recurring calendar item.
[In t:OccurrenceInfoType Complex Type] The type of End is xs:dateTime.
[In t:OccurrenceInfoType Complex Type] End: Contains the end time of a modified occurrence of a recurring calendar item.
[In t:OccurrenceInfoType Complex Type] The type of OriginalStart is xs:dateTime.
[In t:OccurrenceInfoType Complex Type] OriginalStart: Contains the original start time of a modified occurrence of a recurring calendar item.

[In t:OnlineMeetingSettingsType Complex Type] The OnlineMeetingSettingsType complex type specifies the settings for an online meeting.<55> <xs:complexType name="OnlineMeetingSettingsType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="LobbyBypass" type="t:LobbyBypassType"/> <xs:element name="AccessLevel" type="t:OnlineMeetingAccessLevelType"/> <xs:element name="Presenters" type="t:PresentersType"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
[In t:OnlineMeetingSettingsType Complex Type] The following table describes the child elements of the OnlineMeetingSettingsType complex type. [LobbyBypass, AccessLevel, Presenters]
[In t:OnlineMeetingSettingsType Complex Type] The type of LobbyBypass is LobbyBypassType (section 2.2.5.8).
[In t:OnlineMeetingSettingsType Complex Type] LobbyBypass: Specifies the settings to bypass the online waiting area.
[In t:OnlineMeetingSettingsType Complex Type] The type of AccessLevel is OnlineMeetingAccessLevelType (section 2.2.5.10).
[In t:OnlineMeetingSettingsType Complex Type] AccessLevel: Specifies who must wait in the online waiting area before online meetings.
[In t:OnlineMeetingSettingsType Complex Type] The type of Presenters is PresentersType (section 2.2.5.11).
[In t:OnlineMeetingSettingsType Complex Type] Presenters: Controls which participants are given presenter privileges when the meeting is scheduled.
[In t:ProposeNewTimeType Complex Type] The ProposeNewTimeType complex type specifies a response to a new time proposal.<56>
[In t:ProposeNewTimeType Complex Type] This type [ProposeNewTimeType] extends the ResponseObjectType complex type ([MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.69).

[In t:ProposeNewTimeType Complex Type] [its schema is] <xs:complexType name="ProposeNewTimeType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="t:ResponseObjectType"/> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>
[In t:RecurrenceType Complex Type] The RecurrenceType complex type contains the recurrence pattern and recurrence range for calendar items and meeting requests.

[In t:RecurrenceType Complex Type] [its schema is] <xs:complexType name="RecurrenceType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:group ref="t:RecurrencePatternTypes" /> <xs:group ref="t:RecurrenceRangeTypes" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
[In t:RecurrenceType Complex Type] The RecurrencePatternTypes group specifies the recurrence pattern for calendar items and meeting requests, as specified in [MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.7.1.

[In t:RecurrenceType Complex Type] The RecurrenceRangeTypes group specifies the recurrence patterns with numbered recurrences, non-ending recurrence patterns, and recurrence patterns with a set start and end date, as specified in [MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.7.2.
[In t:RemoveItemType Complex Type] The RemoveItemType complex type specifies a response object that is used to remove a meeting item when a meeting cancellation message item is received.
[In t:RemoveItemType Complex Type] This complex type extends the ResponseObjectType complex type, as specified in [MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.59.
[In t:RemoveItemType Complex Type] [its schema is] <xs:complexType name="RemoveItemType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="t:ResponseObjectType" /> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>
[In t:TentativelyAcceptItemType Complex Type] The TentativelyAcceptItemType complex type specifies a response object that is used to tentatively accept a meeting invitation or calendar item.
[In t:TentativelyAcceptItemType Complex Type] This complex type extends the MeetingRegistrationResponseObjectType complex type, as specified in [MS-OXWSCDATA] section 2.2.4.16.

[In t:TentativelyAcceptItemType Complex Type] [its schema is] <xs:complexType name="TentativelyAcceptItemType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="t:MeetingRegistrationResponseObjectType" /> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType>
[In t:TimeChangeType Complex Type] The TimeChangeType complex type represents the date and time when the time changes to and from daylight saving time and standard time.

[In t:TimeChangeType Complex Type] [its schema is] <xs:complexType name="TimeChangeType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Offset" type="xs:duration" /> <xs:group minOccurs="0" ref="t:TimeChangePatternTypes" /> <xs:element name="Time" type="xs:time" /> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="TimeZoneName" type="xs:string" use="optional" /> </xs:complexType>
[In t:TimeChangeType Complex Type] The following table lists the child elements of the TimeChangeType complex type. [Offset, Time]
[In t:TimeChangeType Complex Type] The type of Offset is xs:duration ([XMLSCHEMA2]).
[In t:TimeChangeType Complex Type] Offset: Specifies the offset from the duration specified by the BaseOffset element (section 2.2.4.29).
[In t:TimeChangeType Complex Type] The type of Time is xs:time ([XMLSCHEMA2]).
[In t:TimeChangeType Complex Type] Time: Specifies the time when the time changes between standard time and daylight saving time.
[In t:TimeChangeType Complex Type] The following table lists the attribute of the TimeChangeType complex type. [TimeZoneName]
[In t:TimeChangeType Complex Type] The type of TimeZoneName is xs:string ([XMLSCHEMA2]).
[In t:TimeChangeType Complex Type] TimeZoneName: Specifies the time zone name.

[In t:TimeZoneType Complex Type] The TimeZoneType complex type MAY<57> represent the time zone of the location where a meeting is hosted. <xs:complexType name="TimeZoneType"> <xs:sequence minOccurs="0" > <xs:element name="BaseOffset" type="xs:duration" /> <xs:sequence minOccurs="0" > <xs:element name="Standard" type="t:TimeChangeType" /> <xs:element name="Daylight" type="t:TimeChangeType" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="TimeZoneName" type="xs:string" use="optional" /> </xs:complexType>
[In t:TimeZoneType Complex Type] The following table lists the child elements of the TimeZoneType complex type. [BaseOffset, Standard, Daylight]
[In t:TimeZoneType Complex Type] The type of BaseOffset is xs:duration ([XMLSCHEMA2]).
[In t:TimeZoneType Complex Type] BaseOffset: Specifies the hourly offset from Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) for the current time zone.
[In t:TimeZoneType Complex Type] The type of Standard is t:TimeChangeType (section 2.2.4.28).
[In t:TimeZoneType Complex Type] Standard: Specifies the date and time when the time changes from daylight saving time to standard time.
[In t:TimeZoneType Complex Type] The type of Daylight is t:TimeChangeType.
[In t:TimeZoneType Complex Type] Daylight: Specifies the date and time when the time changes from standard time to daylight saving time.
[In t:TimeZoneType Complex Type] The following table lists the attribute of the TimeZoneType complex type. [TimeZoneName]
[In t:TimeZoneType Complex Type] The type of TimeZoneName is xs:string ([XMLSCHEMA2]).
[In t:TimeZoneType Complex Type] TimeZoneName: Specifies the time zone name.

[In Simple Types] The following table [Table in section 2.2.5] summarizes the set of common XML schema simple type definitions defined by this specification [t:CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType, t:CalendarItemTypeType, t:CalendarItemUpdateOperationType, t:MeetingRequestTypeType, t:ResponseTypeType, t:CalendarPermissionLevelType, t:CalendarPermissionReadAccessType,t:EmailReminderChangeType ,t:EmailReminderSendOption ,t:LobbyBypassType ,t:OnlineMeetingAccessLevelType ,t:PresentersType ].
[In Simple Types] XML schema simple type definitions that are specific to a particular operation are described with the operation.
[In Simple Types] CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType: Specifies how meeting requests and cancellations are handled.
[In Simple Types] CalendarItemTypeType: Identifies the type of a calendar item.
[In Simple Types] CalendarItemUpdateOperationType: Specifies how meeting updates are communicated after a calendar item is updated.
[In Simple Types] CalendarPermissionLevelType: Specifies the permission level that a user has on a Calendar folder.
[In Simple Types] CalendarPermissionReadAccessType: Specifies the permissions a user has to view items in a Calendar folder.
[In Simple Types] EmailReminderChangeType : Specifies the types of changes that can be made to an email reminder for an occurrence.
[In Simple Types] EmailReminderSendOption : Specifies the send options for the reminder.
[In Simple Types] LobbyBypassType: Specifies the settings to bypass the online waiting area.<58>
[In Simple Types] MeetingRequestTypeType: Describes the types of meeting requests.
[In Simple Types] OnlineMeetingAccessLevelType: Specifies who must wait in the online waiting area before online meetings.<59>
[In Simple Types] PresentersType: Controls which participants are given presenter privileges when the meeting is scheduled.<60>
[In Simple Types] ResponseTypeType: Represents the types of recipient (1)responses that are received for a meeting.
[In t:CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType Simple Type] The CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType simple type specifies how meeting request creations and cancellations are communicated.

[In t:CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType Simple Type] [its schema is] <xs:simpleType name="CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string" > <xs:enumeration value="SendToNone" /> <xs:enumeration value="SendOnlyToAll" /> <xs:enumeration value="SendToAllAndSaveCopy" /> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType>

[In t:CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType Simple Type] The following table lists the xs:string ([XMLSCHEMA2]) enumeration values that are defined by the CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType simple type: [SendToNone, SendOnlyToAll, SendToAllAndSaveCopy].

[In t:CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType Simple Type] SendToNone: For the CreateItem operation ([MS-OXWSCORE] section 3.1.4.2), this value specifies that the meeting is created in the organizer's Calendar folder.

[In t:CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType Simple Type] SendToNone: [For the CreateItem operation ([MS-OXWSCORE] section 3.1.4.2), this value specifies that] no meeting request is sent to attendees.

[In t:CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType Simple Type] SendToNone: [For the CreateItem operation ([MS-OXWSCORE] section 3.1.4.2), this value specifies that the meeting is created in the organizer's Calendar folder but no meeting request is sent to attendees.] Because no meeting request is generated, the meeting is not created in each attendee's Calendar folder.

[In t:CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType Simple Type] SendToNone: For the DeleteItem operation ([MS-OXWSCORE] section 3.1.4.3) this value specifies that the meeting is deleted from the organizer's Calendar folder.

[In t:CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType Simple Type] SendToNone: [For the DeleteItem operation ([MS-OXWSCORE] section 3.1.4.3) this value specifies that] no meeting cancellation message is sent to attendees.
[In t:CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType Simple Type] SendOnlyToAll: For the CreateItem operation, this value specifies that the meeting is created in the organizer's Calendar folder.
[In t:CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType Simple Type] SendOnlyToAll: [For the CreateItem operation, this value specifies that] a meeting request is sent to all attendees.
[In t:CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType Simple Type] SendOnlyToAll: [For the CreateItem operation, this value specifies that] the meeting is created in each attendee's Calendar folder.

[In t:CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType Simple Type] SendOnlyToAll: [For the CreateItem operation, this value specifies that] No copy of the meeting request is saved in the organizer's Sent Items folder.
[In t:CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType Simple Type] SendOnlyToAll: For the DeleteItem operation, this value specifies that the meeting is deleted from the organizer's Calendar folder.

[In t:CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType Simple Type] SendOnlyToAll: [For the DeleteItem operation, this value specifies that the meeting is deleted from the organizer's Calendar folder and] a meeting cancellation message is sent to all attendees.
[In t:CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType Simple Type] SendOnlyToAll: [For the DeleteItem operation, this value specifies that] no copy of the meeting cancellation message is saved.
[In t:CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType Simple Type] SendToAllAndSaveCopy: For the CreateItem operation, this value specifies that the meeting is created in the organizer's Calendar folder.
[In t:CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType Simple Type] SendToAllAndSaveCopy: [For the CreateItem operation, this value specifies that] a meeting request is sent to all attendees.
[In t:CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType Simple Type] SendToAllAndSaveCopy: [For the CreateItem operation, this value specifies that] the meeting is created in each attendee's Calendar folder.

[In t:CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType Simple Type] SendToAllAndSaveCopy: [For the CreateItem operation, this value specifies that] A copy of the meeting request is saved in the organizer's Sent Items folder.
[In t:CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType Simple Type] SendToAllAndSaveCopy: For the DeleteItem operation, this value specifies that the meeting is deleted from the organizer's Calendar folder.
[In t:CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType Simple Type] SendToAllAndSaveCopy: [For the DeleteItem operation, this value specifies that] a meeting cancellation message is sent to all attendees.

[In t:CalendarItemCreateOrDeleteOperationType Simple Type] SendToAllAndSaveCopy: [For the DeleteItem operation, this value specifies that] a copy of the meeting cancellation message is saved in the organizer's Sent Items folder.
[In t:CalendarItemTypeType Simple Type] The CalendarItemTypeType simple type specifies the type of a calendar item.
